name: Grilled Pork Chops with Tangy Slaw & Rosemary Potato Slices
description: Quick, family-friendly braai pork chops served with a crisp cabbage-carrot slaw and grilled rosemary potato slices. Mild flavors and simple steps for a balanced grill-and-salad plate.
prep_steps: Slice potatoes into 1 cm rounds; toss with 1.5 tbsp olive oil, 1/2 tsp salt, 1/4 tsp black pepper, and rosemary.
Season pork chops with 1 tbsp olive oil, 1 tsp salt, and 1/2 tsp black pepper.
Shred cabbage (about 4 cups) and grate carrots (about 1 cup).
In a large bowl, whisk mayonnaise with apple cider vinegar, a pinch of salt, and black pepper to taste; add cabbage and carrots and toss to coat.
Lightly oil grill grates. If not using an OutdoorGrill, preheat a stove-top grill pan over medium-high.
cook_steps: Place potato slices on the grill; cook 6–8 minutes per side until tender with char marks. Move to a cooler spot if browning too fast.
Grill pork chops 4–5 minutes per side (depending on thickness) until cooked through and juices run clear; rest 3 minutes.
Taste slaw and adjust seasoning with more vinegar, salt, or black pepper if needed.
Serve pork chops with a heap of slaw and rosemary potato slices.
